sourceQuote: Diagnostics need explicit, machine-readable run completeness states.
Checkpoint-aware resumes should preserve successful shard work.
Schema and parser failures must remain visible in final bundle output.
Provider timeouts should map to deterministic failure diagnostics.
Successful shards should still contribute extractions when peers fail.
Constraint failures must not silently collapse into empty evidence states.
Program definitions should encode structured intent beyond plain prompt strings.
Class declarations need deterministic validation and duplicate protection.

sourceQuote: Constraints should default deterministically when omitted by callers.
Legacy call sites should normalize into canonical program structures.
Invalid class schemas should fail before provider calls are attempted.
Program contracts should require structured fields for reproducibility.
Bench regressions should include program-shape normalization coverage.
Program identifiers should be deterministic across equivalent inputs.
Top-level character offsets should be accepted directly without requiring nested span input.
Legacy span-shaped offsets must still map correctly into deterministic global offsets.
True empty evidence should remain distinguishable from offset parsing failures.
Malformed payloads must fail explicitly instead of producing silent empty outputs.
Conflicting offset representations should be rejected deterministically.
Array-form provider payloads should still produce validated extraction offsets.
Out-of-range offsets must fail quote invariant checks with explicit diagnostics.
Payload-shape mismatches should remain visible when extraction arrays are missing.
